meanings.definition: The state of being alert and vigilant.
meanings.sent1: Her watchfulnesses during the night kept her family safe from harm.
meanings.sent2: The security guard's watchfulnesses prevented any unauthorized entry into the building.
meanings.sent3: The watchfulnesses of the cat made sure no mouse could sneak by unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: His watchfulnesses were like a shield, protecting him from any potential danger.
meanings.sent5: The watchfulnesses of the lifeguard ensured that all swimmers were safe in the pool.

meanings.definition: The act of paying close attention to something.
meanings.sent1: The watchfulnesses of the students during the exam ensured no cheating occurred.
meanings.sent2: His watchfulnesses while driving prevented any accidents on the road.
meanings.sent3: The watchfulnesses of the chef made sure the soup didn't boil over.
meanings.sent4: Her watchfulnesses were like a magnifying glass, catching every detail.
meanings.sent5: The watchfulnesses of the referee ensured fair play during the game.

meanings.definition: The quality of being observant and cautious.
meanings.sent1: The watchfulnesses of the detective led to the capture of the criminal.
meanings.sent2: Her watchfulnesses in the forest kept her safe from any lurking dangers.
meanings.sent3: The watchfulnesses of the squirrel ensured it never missed a nut falling from the tree.
meanings.sent4: His watchfulnesses were like a radar, detecting any potential threats.
meanings.sent5: The watchfulnesses of the hiker saved him from stepping on a hidden snake.
